author: alkebulan.alliance
title: East African Cardano Community Hubs
description: 東アフリカの人々は、Catalystコミュニティの中でも存在感が薄い。EAからのCatalyst参加者を集めることで、インパクトを与えることができます。

f6_assessments.q0: the title of this proposal is clear and well defined. "Host a meeting in Eastern Town Hall to support Catalyst members from Eastern Africa." Host "A MEETING" One. For $35000. There are no other goals enumerated. In either the proposal writeup or in the attached document which is a great geography/demographics resource but nothing else.  There is no way to understand the impact of this proposal as written.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has no stated goals. So how to determine feasibility of achieving something unstated? Can not say it is feasible. The team seems illustrious, but there is only one linkedin reference or other specific reference to actual experience. Just words and names.
f6_assessments.q2: Lacks clarity no information about the stated goal (as stated in the solution - Hold One Meeting) so can not be audited

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has identified a problem and a solution for the problem but they are presented in a vague manner as is unclear who are the "Catalyst members" that are underrepresented in the community. Bringing people together for a good cause requires a lot of effort and consumes many resources.

The KPIs/metrics for the target audience are not defined (how many people can or will attend the town hall? How many of these people will benefit from what they see/hear and add value to the Cardano ecosystem? etc.). 

The goals of the proposal are not well defined and this could be an issues for the success of the project. (Eastern Africa is huge, trying to start locally or at a country level will fit better for the purpose of this project).
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer made statements about the team members number (six) and their experience which seems to fit well for the purpose of this proposal and also their role in the team can be identified. However to add weight to those words it is recommended to sustain the experience with links/trails (social media, projects, repositories etc.) that point to some public info.

The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items. However the price per word ($.28) for translated material seems to be overpriced as a median price in a western country could go bellow $.10 and it's unclear what "Project town Hall" means (in terms of actions/results). Also is a bit unclear which of the six members of the team will be involved in the project as the budget is built for 4 persons.
A time table is provided and seems reasonable to be achieved.

The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation. (as I said, maybe it would be better to start locally, as covering Eastern Africa is indeed a challenge from many aspects - logistic, time spent etc.).

The proposal should define the topics to be covered in the materials provided to the meeting. Cardano ecosystem is growing at a steady pace and there are plenty of resources to be shown to the target audience. Choosing the right topics could avoid the risk of losing peoples' interest for the meeting (i.e.: topics: DeFi, Wallets, NFTs etc.)

KPIs/metrics should be defined to measure the expected output (i.e.: questionnaire about the audience satisfaction, how many people downloaded an ADA wallet in a defined time period etc.)
f6_assessments.q2:
A roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement is defined but is unclear how the succes will look like.

The given metrics measure what the proposer wants to do, but the success of his actions is not defined. (measurable outputs from the meeting, feedbacks etc.)

As mentioned above, the description of the solution is described in a vague manner. Possible challenges/risks are not considered. In conclusion, the progress of this proposal is hard to assess.

f6_assessments.q0: I think that this proposal should better fit in the multilingual category. Apart from that, it fits the challenge as education of the local communities is the starting point of the adoption of cardano. What's the best way to educate people if not in their own languages? And that is what this proposal is trying to achieve. The success of this proposal will definitely have a positive impact for the cardano community because most people will be able to access the information in their own languages. It's a 4 for me.
f6_assessments.q1:
It's clear, based on the proposal details, that the proposer has a good knowledge about the subject. Being in the digital marketing field for a long time, I see that all the tools needed to build a website and attract users are outlined in this proposal. The team is based on the proposer of many technical profiles who should be able to build the website. The proposer has also specified the desire to hire a seo specialist who will help their google ranking and attract users.
The budget specified is broken down into bite size pieces, and are easy to understand.
The only problem that I have found is the lack of proof about the team members. I think that the proposer could link the linkedin profiles of the team members. This would've added more credibility and strength to the feasibility of this project. I give it a 4 rating.
f6_assessments.q2: Although this proposal has very good chances to add value to the community, the proposer has failed to provide a detailed roadmap and the kpis needed to properly audit the project. I would suggest to the proposer to add a roadmap and a timetable of what is expected in 3, 6 and 12 months.

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree to the above proposal because it's  identifies the solution to solve the above challenge and in scope with it.

The proposal show clearly how it will add value to the cardano ecosystem in the Easting part of Africa by letting people learn how to be Marketing specialist, Community Outreach, Project Managemen etc..

key metrics and goals of the proposal is been stated clearly and falls in scope with the challenge .

 The proposal also scale to address future challengies because there are uneducated people at teen age that can have a better furture throught reciaving education on blockchain in their own language in East africa...
f6_assessments.q1:
Strongly agreed! why;
Because the proposer provide evidence, reference, links etc of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal and the links are sufficient and accurate  and level of competent is good.

The proposer also shows in identifiable manner the type of and number of team members required to implement the proposal and has laid put how teams are going to operate if the proposal is been funded.

IS budget has been laid down and brocken into identifiable items accuratly and has a time table to complete the project if funded.

The plan of the proposal also describes the resource necessary  to implement the proposal by Host a meeting in Eastern Town Hall to support Catalyst members from Eastern Africa.
f6_assessments.q2:
Strongly agreed  because there are clearly laid down road maps  for the achievement if funded and clearly metrics/KPI's that define the success of the proposal.

looking at the solution, it simply describes the tagerted problem and how to address it understandably.

f6_assessments.q0:
Relation to personal qualifications: As a year-long activist in both party-politics and non-party related political (grassroots) groups I know how important decentralised communities are for democratic and economic empowerment. This knowledge gives me the skills to assess proposals in this challenge. The proposal identifies an important problem within the challenge: The underrepresentation of East Africans within the Cardano ecosystem. As Cardano has a global mission, solving this problem will not just benefit the Cardano Ecosystem, but also be of great benefit to the local people by providing them new opportunities. The key metrics and goals of the proposal align excellently with the outlined challenge settings.
Since the Eastern Townhall is a great multiplicator as it is a big network,  it can sure be said that the proposal is able to scale to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Eastern Townhall are a really vital and active Part of the Catalyst community. Without a doubt alkebulan alliance will be able to successfully implement this proposal in cooperation with them. This is also indicated by a quite well-planned proposal: The proposers know the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal and basically have a large group as their support network. 
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and is reasonable to achieve the set goals.
The proposal offers a realistic timetable and roadmap to complete the work and a very detailed, rationable and transparent implementation plan. It describes the resources used and every imaginable detail is shown. This is a great example of a good, feasible proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: A clear, understandable problem description is accompanied by a very detailed, auditable description of a solution. Metrics are not defined explicitly, neither is a roadmap. However some deliverables are defined, which gives this proposal still a decent auditability

f6_assessments.q0:
The historical and social information of the environment is adequate. However, I think that aspects such as 1 video per week for 24 weeks and translation services worth $21,000 fit into Cardano's overall strategy of penetration into East Africa.  

Event-based methodologies and audio-visual material are perhaps must-have tools to open communication to potential new communities.  However, without a more specific, in-depth knowledge of the dynamics taking place in the geographical area to be addressed, it could be like drilling in a field without knowing its specific characteristics: in many cases the drill bit will end up breaking without penetrating.  

Organizations such as WADA and others that have done excellent work on the continent (hand in hand with Catalyst and the Cardano ecosystem) have accumulated a valuable amount of experience that would be worth consulting.

Methods such as events have been so commonly used that their rate of effectiveness has tended to decline dramatically. A 10% budget deserves a little more brainstorming with those who have already battled those struggles.
f6_assessments.q1:
- Items in the budget are still discriminated in a very general way. 

- Please attach links to external information of the team members.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no KPIs to measure the development of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Amazing proposal and vision. This meets all of the requirements to meet the challenge brief with the core underlying mission of "Host a meeting in Eastern Town Hall to support Catalyst members from Eastern Africa." Hopefully you get the feedback desired which will end with a successfully funded campaign. I scored this well as I believe that a East African target market is an important sector and to present these Cardano facts to these key segments could yeild some significant results. I understood your solution to the problem stated and I feel its relevance. The benefitting community is self explanatory and you have adequately addressed the education and adoptions aspects of this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the detail and depth of the team you have assembled I am confident that with the various skillsets on display that you will find success with this project. Your plan is solid and with a few extra tweaks I feel like this could be a great initiative.
f6_assessments.q2: The only area I scored this down for was with regards to the lack of incorporating more of the Key Metrics into your proposal. I feel that you could provide some more metrics like 'The number of people engaged' and further to follow-up at various milestones advising of the status of the engagement (i.e. if they have attended a meetup, are they are planning some future engagement etc)

solution: 東部アフリカのCatalystメンバーを支援するミーティングを東部タウンホールで開催。問題を解決しようとする献身的な人々が与える影響
experience: マーケティングスペシャリスト、コミュニティアウトリーチ、プロジェクトマネジメント、DevOps、テクニカルコンテンツライター＆アナリスト、英語、スワヒリ語、フランス語が堪能
